channel.title: 4 Alive, game ended in a draw?
channel.description:
https://i.imgur.com/qnsgeU1.jpg
7, 12, 14, 16 were all alive. Game ended in a draw. I will report user 12 "KoreanBeagle346" with a link to this thread for research purposes. 2 BD and 2 Cult still alive, Prince should have run out of Jails and CL should have won with kills. I think?
If it helps you search reports, my report from ingame contains #KitLiz005 in the comments

item.title: 4 Alive, game ended in a draw?
item.dc:creator: geoelectric
item.description:
Edited: no, you’re right, found the .10 patch notes and Prince is limited to three times total.

Read full topic

item.title: 4 Alive, game ended in a draw?
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
It’s not 3 in a row. It’s 3 total. And jail counts towards that for butler meaning that the butler would be converted after 9 nights

Cl occupies 3 times. Cl jailed 3 times. Butler jailed 3 times

Read full topic
item.source: 4 Alive, game ended in a draw?

item.title: 4 Alive, game ended in a draw?
item.dc:creator: geoelectric
item.description:
@KitLiz, I was in that game (13) and one of the only spectators to stay until the end.

My take was that CL (16) was out of eradicates, and only way to get more was to sac 14, but that would’ve put Cult in the minority and so they would lose the day after the sacrifice. So, killing wasn’t an option.

Meanwhile, Prince (12) could jail CL and Butler (7) alternately so no conversion could happen and nobody trips the 3-in-a-row prevention. CL was occupy immune by then, but it wouldn’t have mattered as long as Prince kept jailing one or the other. I’m pretty sure 14 was just flat out of charges by that point.

Read full topic
item.source: 4 Alive, game ended in a draw?
